function_call.name: classify_risks
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Increase in home residency due to covid-19 pandemic","category":"Behavioral risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Remote learning in public schools","category":"Behavioral risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Shift in energy use behavior","category":"Behavioral risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Increase in household energy use due to prolonged time spent at home during the covid-19 pandemic.","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Surge in covid-19 cases coinciding with an increase in non-hvac energy use during a specific period.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Non-weather normalized loads analysis increases the risk of incomplete understanding of load behavior across a day-long period, potentially leading to inaccurate conclusions.","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Comparison of energy consumption across income levels may reveal disparities in access to resources and energy usage patterns, with potential implications for public health and well-being.","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Study of hvac and non-hvac loads across pandemic and pre-pandemic periods may provide insights into the impact of public health crises on indoor environmental quality and disease transmission in built environments.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Dependence on outdoor weather conditions for hvac loads","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inaccurate load characterization of non-hvac loads","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Limited comparison of hvac consumption across years","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Limited sample sizes for household income data analysis","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Potential outliers in household income data","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Incomplete data in housing unit records","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Data obtained from household survey may contain personal or sensitive information about occupants.","category":"Data Privacy and Security risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Close proximity and high density of occupants in housing units may lead to increased risk of contagious disease transmission.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Use of temperature data to analyze hvac use may reveal patterns of occupant behavior and routines.","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Regular data collection and monitoring of electricity use in housing units may lead to increased human contact in the built environment, potentially facilitating the spread of contagious diseases.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Submetering of building energy usage requires physical installation of ct coils on each circuit, potentially increasing the exposure of maintenance staff and installers to contagious diseases.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Limited monitoring of certain circuits due to the constraints of the home energy monitoring system may result in incomplete data collection, affecting the accuracy of energy use analysis.","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Gathering data from multiple housing units in different states increases the risk of cross-contamination of infectious diseases.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Comparison of pre-pandemic and post-pandemic electricity use may overlook the potential impact of contagious diseases on energy consumption patterns.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Drawing conclusions about changes in energy use behavior without considering the influence of contagious diseases may lead to incomplete findings.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Covid-19 pandemic introducing unprecedented changes in residential building energy consumption.","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Increased energy consumption due to changes in occupant behavior and usage of residential buildings during the pandemic.","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Reliance on historical data and assumptions for building energy modeling may not accurately reflect current energy consumption patterns.","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Limited information quantifying consumption variations by sector","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Increased use of electricity in the residential sector shifts additional energy costs to households","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of measured data from individual households to understand the direct impact on energy use behavior","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Increased time spent at home during the pandemic may have led to differences in temperature tolerances and influenced hvac use, impacting energy consumption and potentially increasing the risk of indoor air quality issues.","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of quantitative data reported on the impacts of covid-19 on energy use of lighting and hvac loads in individual buildings, leading to uncertainty and potential inefficiencies in energy management strategies.","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Limited ability for households using setback features to benefit from reduced heating and cooling energy use during unoccupied periods due to increased occupancy during the pandemic, potentially leading to higher energy consumption and reduced cost savings.","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Increased electricity usage in residential buildings due to changes in behavior during the pandemic.","category":"Behavioral risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Limited quantification of changes in electricity use for typical housing units during the pandemic.","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Impact of changes in heating and cooling hvac energy use in residential buildings during the pandemic.","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Increase in streaming services, social media use, remote work applications, and gaming","category":"Behavioral risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Increased use of electronics and internet services in residential buildings","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Increased use of household appliances and indoor cooking","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Increased remote work options leading to reduced occupancy in offices and increased occupancy in homes","category":"Behavioral risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Shift in energy consumption patterns due to lifestyle adjustments during the pandemic","category":"Behavioral risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Increased data usage and broadband usage during the pandemic","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Higher and more variable population during the pandemic","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Increase in unemployment rate during the pandemic","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Rise in teleworking during the pandemic","category":"Behavioral risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Spread of covid-19 due to stay-at-home orders","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Displacement of children and students from educational environments","category":"Behavioral risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"High unemployment rates due to business restrictions","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Potential spread of covid-19 within construction sites due to lack of safety protocols","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Shutdown of construction sites due to covid-19 outbreaks","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Uncertainty in project continuity due to pandemic-related decision-making processes","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium"}]}
